Purpose and scope

In this vehicle assembly process, the focus lays on the integration of the battery pack in the vehicle.Handling a battery pack, connecting the high voltage cables and commissioning the vehicle are relatively new activities in the production line.

Vehicles approved under the UNECE regulations need to be manufactured in such way that the requirements of the regulation are met. This shall be verified by appropriate production checks . The following shall be available:>/p>

  • procedures for the effective quality control of vehicles
  • testing equipment necessary for checking the conformity of each approved type
  • recorded test results
  • a analysis of the results of each type of test, in order to verify and ensure the consistency of characteristics of the vehicle, making allowance for permissible variations in industrial production,
  • ensure that at least the tests prescribed in the regulations are carried out
  • further sampling and tests when any set of samples or test pieces are giving evidence of non-conformity

The approval authority may at any time verify the conformity control methods applied in each production unit.

If the above requirements are not fulfilled, the granted approval may be withdrawn.

Structure of the process

  • First step is the pre assembly
  • After the pre assembly the packs are checked for a last time to see if they are damaged or not. Damaged packs need to be removed from the line and handled separately.
  • The good packs are mounted in the vehicle where all the high voltage connections are made
  • Before the vehicle is ready, it needs to be commissioned
